betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§oMy consciousness fades in, my brain catching up to my body as the last of my atoms materialize. The teleporter ride was bumpier than normal, the fog in my head quite unusual. Something was definitely wrong.

    I drew sidearm quickly, realizing I was not at my planet side base. I was... outside? Was my teleporter signal hijacked again? Is the system on the fritz? I just repaired it...

    When I felt I was not in immediate danger, I decided to look at my personal AI Tablet to get a scan of the area.

    I pulled the slim, flat tablet from it's pouch on my side, only to find out it had changed. As had my sidearm, but that didn't concern me quite as much...

    Now my pAIT was a thin book instead of a flat tablet. In fact, I am dictating this journal into it right now. It was still a computer, but the cover was no longer marked with my own ship's flag, but with the words : §r

                  §l§nEscape from Minekov§r
                      §l§nSurvival Guide

§oThe moment I opened the electronic book, the screens came to life. My ship's flag popped up on the home screen, along with a title graphic with the same text as the cover. Before I could tap one of the icons, a familiar voice spoke to me.§r

    §2System Error. Galaxinet connection severed. Database corruption detected. Entering Condition 10 Situation. Analyzing and repairing...§r

    §oWell, it sounded like my AI. I let out a breath I had been holding. Condition 10 was serious, though. It meant it's 'persona' and any 'sociable' traits it was programmed with or 'learned' were disabled. §r

    §2Corrupted areas repaired and/or quarentined. Downgrading to Condition 8. Scanning immediate status.§r

    §oThat was a little better. Eight was still full serious mode. As it worked, I kept what had been my sidearm ready. Only now, it was a knife. I mean, it was a pretty big knife, but it wasn't the same as a gun.§r

    §2Global network detected. Security upgraded. Connecting....connected. Downgrading to Condition 5. Persona subroutines reactivated. Nice to see you're still alive, Bandit.§r

    §o"Bandit?," my pAI had a bad habit of calling me all manner of nicknames instead of my real name. I usually didn't mind, but Bandit was a new one.§r

    §2Your new nickname. You'll understand in a bit, my friend. For now, get to somewhere safe before night falls. I suggest constructing a shelter yourself. The current inhabitants aren't very friendly to guests.

§oWas this place safe? I guess. I didn't have my armored spacesuit on, or my phaser pistol, or any of my other belt gadgets I was so used to having.

    "Okay, what is going on, Z?" I asked my pAI after settling in to my hiding spot. Z was the name I'd given them so long ago I don't quite remember why.§r

    §2My background processes are currently scanning through that network I connected to. I'm amazed its still functioning at all. But that is definitely not the big problem here, Bandit.§r

    §o"And that is...?"§r

    §2We aren't in Kansas anymore, Dorothy. Or America. Or Earth. Or Dimension Minecraftia, for that matter.§r

    §o"What is this, an isekai or something"§r

    §2You could say that. Looks like we got dropped into one of the deeper parallel dimensions, Bandit. The fundamental rules are different here, it seems.§r

    §o"Like...?"§r

    §2Well, of the ones that determine your immediate survival... A majority of things cannot be crafted in this dimension.§r

    §oMy heart skipped a bit. Crafting was life and blood in Minecraftia. "What CAN I craft, Z?"§r

    §2According to the net, you can still craft many decorative blocks, basic tools, and any food. Looks like basic Iron tools are fine...if you can find Iron that is.§r

    §o"What does THAT mean?"§r

    §2§2You won't find ores just laying around in the ground. Just junk to scavenge through.§r

    §o"What happened to this place?"§r

    §2Oh, back to back world changing apocalypse events, tearing through the fabric of space and time and magic. You know, the usual. §r

    I opened my mouth to ask another question then closed it, and started to go through the implications.

§2Bandit? You've been quiet for almost ten minutes. Are you okay?§r

    §oI snapped out of my deep thoughts, rubbing my face a few times, "Yeah, sorry about that Z. We're definitely in a big pickle."§r

    §2Pickle factory.§r

    §o"No kidding. I've got a million questions but that's not going to keep me alive right now. Instead I'll just ask...Survival Guide?"§r

    §2When crossing dimensions, sometimes objects you carry transform into a similar analog object.§r


    §o"Except..."§r

    §2Your suit, tools, etc didn't all transfer over, yeah. Space time fabric holes is the best explanation I got, Bandit. You got a knife at least. And my pAI tablet. Or really, Survival Guide. I transformed into an ebook! A good one, at least. Most of my functions are intact. And I got some new ones it looks like? I'll explore those later.§r

    §o"Not knowing why is frustrating. But not much I can do on that, yeah. Okay, if I can't craft most things, how do I gear up to survive here? And get food? Growing things takes a while, and I can already feel myself starving..."§r

    §2Oh please. That stable Sushi pack you always carry survived. Eat that. As for the answer to both questions?

    Shoot and Loot. It's hunting time, Bandit.

§oAfter a short discussion with my pAI and getting a bit of a rest in, I gathered my gear and set out to start hunting. I made sure to mark my safe house on my map (using the J key), as I had the feeling I'd need a base of operations if I wanted any hope of getting out of here. 

    From what Z could gather, there were four factions at play in this world : 
 
    The remnants of civilized society were huddled in small villages that dotted the landscape. Dubbed simply §l§oVillagers§r§o, they farmed, traded, and just tried to survive day to day.

    A few survivors have set up a trade network. The §o§lTraders§r§o, as they called themselves, use the Global Network to buy and sell nearly everything. They don't just work with anyone, reputation is important to them. We'll have to find their representatives in world and gain their trust before we can work with them.

    Many survivors, however, did not band together for the greater good. Instead, the mantra of a dog eat dog world is apt, as they have gathered into roving gangs of §lScavengers§r§o, attacking villagers, traders, and each other for the supplies to survive.

    The last faction, and definitely the largest and always growing larger, are the §lMonsters§r§o. Twisted creatures, the undead, and more roam the abandoned cities, many of them attracted the discarded items of civilization.

    Our targets were the latter two. Some of them should have some stuff we can salvage for food, gear, and resources.

    Fighting is going to be deadly, I probably won't have time to search over most of what I loot until its safe.

§2Bandit, while you've been hunting, I have finally got in contact with a §lTrader§r§2. He says he's with the VanilModu Trading Company. They are usually the first contact for §lVillagers§r§2 who want to start working to become §lTraders§r §2or §lMercenaries§r§2, which took the name Bandit.§r

    §o"Oh, THATS why you chose that nickname this time?"§r

    §2I only saw references when I first started going through the Global Network information. They were seen in a positive light by some, and quite negatively by others, so I took a guess that it would fit.§r

    §oHm, an odd nickname for a Mercenary. I wonder if the word's definition was slightly different in this world, or if Z mistranslated something. Either way... "Okay, so how do I meet with this Trader?"§r

    §2You don't. Not yet that is. All Trader groups work off of reputation, and well, we have absolutely zilch reputation amongst them right now. 

    He says, however, that he's willing to start trading with us if you send him some Bread as a token gesture. Once you do, he'll connect a minimal part of his shop to our Survival Guide. If we fill a couple more of his requests, he'll offer more trades, and start talking with you to boot.§r

    §oI wonder if this was like breaking bread back home as a form of bonding? Either way, time to either grow some wheat or hunt down a bakery...
Great, where are we now? Time to get our bearings and figure out where we landed this time...
